page.title: 06FARMING PRACTICES OF AREA
page.content: The majority of farms in this area have been split into small parcels of land now grazed by horses and, due to a high subsidy, sheep. The largest holding is the 300 acre Rystwood Farm which includes Lines Farm and Upper Parrock. This farm ceased milk production in 1984 and now produces hay, barley and straw for sale. There is a small bought-in calf unit. The area has one 90 acre dairy farm and two farms of under 100 acres with breeding ewes. There are several small holdings for fattening beef and pigs and one deer farm. There are no commercial orchards, one pick-your-own soft fruit farm combined with a herb & shrub nursery. The remainder of holdings are small grass farms producing hay for the large equine population.
